ch.usi.dag.disl

Interface Transformer


  • public interface Transformer
    Represents a bytecode-level class transformer. A Transformer is expected to consume an array of bytes representing the contents of a class file, process it, and return an array of bytes representing the class file contents of the the modified class, or null if the class was not modified in any way. This mimics the convention established by the ClassFileTransformer interface.

    Transformers are applied to classes before being processed by DiSL, and need to be specified using the DiSL-Transformers attribute in the manifest of a .jar file containing the instrumentation classes. The attribute lists the names of classes implementing the Transformer interface, separated by a comma. The transformer are applied in the listed order.

    Note: The implementation of a Transformer implementation MUST be thread-safe, and the implementing class MUST provide a default (parameterless) constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] transform(byte[] classFileBytes)
      Transforms the given class bytecode and returns the bytecode of the transformed class.

        Transforms the given class bytecode and returns the bytecode of the transformed class.
